intro: Symphostemon, commonly known as the candlewood tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale in color. Symphostemon species typically have simple, opposite leaves and produce small, fleshy fruits. These plants are often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
